children.subject: Hmm, that's weird. Please contact Michael-David, our enrollment specialist. sasson@berkeley.edu
I declared early for CS at the end of the spring semester. Am I supposed to be waitlisted for CS61C right now?

Assuming we are able to hire like we have in the past, I would say you have good chances. But this year we are experiencing some budget constraints, so I don't really have anything concrete unfortunately. In general, if you are on the waitlist, we still recommend students to plan for backups.

"If you are on the waitlist and your waitlist position is higher than the number of available seats, please do plan for a back up course."

So for CS 168, if I am less than #120 on the waitlist, would you say I have a good chance of getting in? Posed a different way, how confident are you all that enough teaching resources will be hired?

"seniors have priority over non-majors on the waitlist" 

Is this senior standing, or seniors meaning graduating senior?

history.content:
Now that phase 2 has begun, we're getting a lot of these questions. CS 168 and CS 186 are particularly popular next semester. We enroll up to 70% of the projected enrollment capacity until we are sure that we have enough teaching resources to fill the class. Please read more about our enrollment policies here. If you are on the waitlist and your waitlist position is higher than the number of available seats, please do plan for a back up course.

  • But I'm a graduating senior, don't I have priority?
    • Yes, we gave seniors priority by restricting enrollment in phase 1. Now that it's phase 2, seniors have priority over non-majors on the waitlist. After phase 2 ends/during adjustment period, neither major status nor class standing will impact enrollment.
  • But I need this course to graduate! 
    • CS 168, 186, 160 will all be taught next semester :D please enroll during phase 1. 

Hope this is helpful. If you do have additional enrollment questions, please let us know.
history.subject: Re: why am I being waitlisted for CS 168 or CS 186? and CS 160/other popular CS course
